data.title: SHUT DOWN!
data.text: Thankfully, this "Hotel" has been shut down and now sits vacant.  I suggest paying a bit more and staying at La Quinta, Travelodge or somewhere else...

data.title: HELL
data.text: HELL. What I describe it. Roaches, drugs (strongly smelled), horrible staff, and uncaring people. AC went out three times, being moved several times. I finally asked to leave, with a refund of my two weeks I paid in advance for. The manager said he didn't care, that there are no refunds, and that was not his problem. I reported this place to the better business bureau. This is the worst filth I ever stayed in.

data.title: Roach hotel
data.text: My husband and I where stranded on Christmas eve and had to stay in the only hotel available.  We ask to see their rooms before we booked a room.  They where very nice enough to show us a room.  It looked clean and we said sure we will stay here.  Soon as we put our luggage down, the ROACHES came out of the wood works!  SOOOO GROSS!  I STARTED REALLY LOOKING at the room and notice they haven't vacuumed in a while.  The cleaner they used on the counters was just sprayed on and it got all over our stuff.  The workers lived in the hotel and their kids ranned wild.  They also had Christmas lights hanging in the people's windows that lived there.  So gheto!  Down in the basement lived the Wichita Fall bums.... DONT STAY HERE IT IS SO GROSS AND DIRTY!

data.title: ok hotel for this town
data.text: We got married in Wichita Falls while my husband was at tech school there. I chose this hotel because I like to experience non-chain hotels. The hotel is pretty old. Parts of the hotel are remodeled and other parts are still pretty old. There is a restaurant in the hotel, but it was only open during certain times of the day. One unexpected perk is that the front desk saw that we were leaving for the court house to get married, and when we returned to the hotel, the resaurant had cut up a platter of fresh fruit and gave it to us as a nice little gift. The staff were all very friendly and accomodating.

data.title: Great for Wichita Falls
data.text:
Got a rate of 45 bucks. Hotel is an older remodeled Ramada Inn. I like the older funkier places and staying in an old downtown spot is exactly what I wanted. I was not disappointed, from underground parking, to there being a street dance downtown while I was there (I had no clue ahead of time) It was great!

Remodelers did a wonderful job of keeping the art-deco looks of a 1950/1960 hotel intact. Don't expect a Hyatt.....and you won't pay Hyatt prices....all in all a very nice little place to stay.

You can go anywhere in town by car in 10 minutes of less!

data.title: Not worth the stars
data.text: We chose this hotel as it was 2 1/2 stars and the price was right.   We used mapquest to locate it...and got lost in a very run down part of town. Thats where we found the hotel.  I guess it is under construction. !st non-smoking room we got,was complete with ash tray and heavy smoke smell.  got that changed. the bed was nice except for the heavily stained  bottom sheet..  the toilet was a gas station variety of the 1950's.dropped ceiling in bath..NO HOT WATER,NO COFFEE POT!!  Would have had to wait until 8:30 am for coffee in the restaurant..and no comp breakfast...  staff was nice,clueless,but nice. it is about a 1 star.

data.title: The best in Wichita Falls
data.text: The hotel staff was top notch. The rooms where clean and fresh. The beds where top of the line for comfort and the high speed Internet was blazing fast. It was every thing the modern traveler needed.

data.title: Best little Hotel Place in Texas
data.text: I just got back from my stay at the Ramada Inn, and I had an excellent time. The staff was amazingly polite and accomidating, and the rooms were nice and comfortable. The lounges were a great place to meet if your staying at the hotel with a large group, like I was, and we all had fun hanging out together there. There is a pool and a gym, and the continental breakfast was really good. Overall I give the Ramada Inn 5 stars, and I would recommend it to anyone going to stay at wichita falls.
